column4: I'm trying to read mail from another linux host on my LAN but I get connection refused from evolution.  How do I allow the connection?
connection refused is either  1) You have a firewall in the way    or   2) The other machine isn't running a suitable demon to let you read mail (e.g. pop or imap demon)
how do I tell if there is a pop or impa daemon running on my fedora2 host?
If you haven't installed one there probably isn't - do a ps and look what is installed or use netstat -p to see what ports things are listening on
